article.headline: George Mason 76, Liberty 72
article.story: FAIRFAX, Va. -- Andre Cornelius had 17 points to lead George Mason to a 76-72 victory over Liberty in their season opener Friday night. Luke Hancock's 3-pointer gave George Mason a 74-66 lead with 31 seconds remaining. Ryan Pearson had 12 points and eight rebounds for GMU. Mike Morrison added 12 points, seven rebounds and three blocks. Kyle Ohman had 23 points, seven rebounds and three assists for Liberty, which has not won a season opener on the road since winning at Brooklyn in 1988. Jesse Sanders added 15 points, seven rebounds and four assists. After making two free throws, Cornelius assisted Mike Morrison's layup on the run for a 68-59 lead. Cornelius shot 3 of 4 from behind the arc to lead GMU to a 40-27 halftime lead. After Ohman scored Liberty's first nine points, Cam Long's 3-pointer gave GMU a 10-9 lead it did not relinquish.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
